DIA_ECS.name: Encephalitis
DIA_ECS.description: Encephalitis is an inflammation of the brain, most commonly caused by an autoimmune reaction or viruses.

DIA_PMN.name: Pneumococcal meningitis
DIA_PMN.description: Pneumococcal meningitis is an inflammation of membranes covering the spinal cord and brain due to the pneumococcal infection.

DIA_SMN.name: Staphylococcal meningitis
DIA_SMN.description: Staphylococcal meningitis is an inflammation of membranes covering the spinal cord and brain due to the staphylococcal infection.

DIA_MIG.name: Migraine
DIA_MIG.description: Migraine is a severe, painful headache with or without aura.

DIA_GBS.name: Guillain-Barre syndrome
DIA_GBS.description: Guillain-Barre syndrome is a serious disease where the immune system attacks its own nervous system.

DIA_NMO.name: Neuromyelitis optica
DIA_NMO.description: Neuromyelitis optica is an auto-immune disease where the immune system attacks the eye nerves and the spinal cord. A condition that is often seen because of multiple sclerosis.

DIA_IPD.name: CIPD
DIA_IPD.description: Chronic inflammatory demyelinizating polyneuropathy is an immune inflammatory disease affecting peripheral nervous system by destructing the cover sheet that protect and insulate the nerves and fibres.

DIA_TTN.name: Tetanus
DIA_TTN.description: Tetanus is a serious bacterial disease affecting the nervous system.

DIA_CLH.name: Cluster headache
DIA_CLH.description: Cluster headaches are extremely painful headaches, often with crying and a dripping nose, that only occur on one side of the head.

DIA_HRP.name: Hypertensive retinopathy
DIA_HRP.description: Hypertensive retinopathy is damage to the retina and retinaâ€™s blood vessels due to high blood pressure.

DIA_BLP.name: Blepharitis
DIA_BLP.description: Blepharitis is inflammation of the eyelid.

DIA_CJN.name: Conjunctivitis (bacterial)
DIA_CJN.description: Conjunctivitis  known as "Pink eye" is an inflammatory disease of the outermost layer of the white part of the eye.

DIA_CAN.name: Conjunctivitis (allergic)
DIA_CAN.description: Conjunctivitis  known as "Pink eye" is an inflammatory disease of the outermost layer of the white part of the eye.

DIA_KRT.name: Keratitis - bacterial
DIA_KRT.description: Keratitis is an inflammatory disease, mostly caused by bacteria, of the cornea - the clear dome surface of the eye.

DIA_CAB.name: Corneal abrasion
DIA_CAB.description: Corneal abrasion - known also as scratched eye is one of the most common eye injuries, when foreign obstacles scratches the eye and produce discomfort and related symptoms.

DIA_UVE.name: Uveitis
DIA_UVE.description: Uveitis refers to inflammation of the part of the eye called the uvea. The uvea includes the iris and some adjacent structures.

DIA_SCL.name: Scleritis
DIA_SCL.description: Scleritis refers to inflammation of the sclera of the eye.

DIA_GLC.name: Open-angle glaucoma
DIA_GLC.description: Glaucoma is a disease that results in damage to the optic nerve, because of high pressure inside the eye .

DIA_ACG.name: Angle-closure glaucoma
DIA_ACG.description: Acute angle-closure glaucoma is caused by sudden and rapid increase of the intraocular pressure.

DIA_CRV.name: CRVO
DIA_CRV.description: Central retinal vein occlusion is one of the common vascular disorders of the eye's retina.

TRM_CCS.name: Concussion
TRM_CCS.description: A concussion is a mild traumatic brain injury resulting in temporary altered mental state and/or loss of function.

TRM_CTS.name: Cerebral contusion
TRM_CTS.description: Cerebral contusion is a traumatic brain injury usually due to blunt head trauma.

TRM_DAI.name: Diffuse axonal injury
TRM_DAI.description: Diffuse axonal injury is one of the most common head traumas, it occurs when the brain shifts too quickly inside the skull.

TRM_TBI.name: Traumatic brain injury
TRM_TBI.description: Occurs when an external force injures the brain. It can be caused by accidents or blunt trauma.

TRM_AIH.name: Subdural hematoma
TRM_AIH.description: Subdural hematoma is a condition where veins in the subdural space are torn and start to bleed. Blood accumulates in the narrow space which increases the pressure inside the skull cavity. The condition is often fatal if left untreated.

TRM_OBI.name: Penetrating trauma - Head
TRM_OBI.description: Penetrating head injury is an injury in which the dura mater, the outer layer of the meninges, is breached.

DIA_051.name: TIA
DIA_051.description: TIA - Transient ischemic attack is similar to a stroke, but usually lasts  up to 24h and causes no permanent damage.

DIA_049.name: PCF
DIA_049.description: PCF - Pharyngoconjunctival fever refers to a condition mostly caused by Human mastadenovirus B, that causes small outbreaks mostly between young people in collectives. The disease affects pharynx and eyes.

DIA_050.name: Botulism
DIA_050.description: Botulism is a rare and potentially fatal illness caused by toxins produced by bacterium Clostridium botulinum.

DIA_TBE.name: Tick-borne encephalitis
DIA_TBE.description: Tick-borne encephalitis is a viral tick-borne infectious disease involving brain and central nervous system.

DIA_RAB.name: Rabies
DIA_RAB.description: Rabies is a deadly virus spread by saliva of infected animals. Transmission is often through animal bites.
